page.title: 01LOWER REDBROOK AND DISTRICT
page.content: {Lower Redbrook},two and a half miles from{Monmouth}, is in the{Wye Valley {at}the edge of the{Forest of Dean. {The Wye}flows from north to south and is the boundary between England and Wales.{Gwent}lies on the west bank and {Gloucestershire}on the east.Access to Gwent is by footbridge only alongside the old railway bridge in Lower Redbrook. The valley is narrow,sides sloping steeply and tree-covered.The whole area is hilly,{height above sea-level {from 15 to 220 metres. There are three villages,{Lower {Redbrook,Newland}and{Penallt}in the immediate area,but no towns.The A466 runs from Monmouth along the valley. The river,streams,forests farmland and villages contribute to the outstanding beauty of this rural area.
